meanings.def: in addition to something already mentioned
examples: I don't want anything else, thanks.
I'm taking a few clothes and some books, not much else.
Ask somebody else to help you.
Haven't you got anything else to wear?
Why didn't you come? Everybody else was there.
Yes I did give it to her. What else could I do?
Keep your mouth shut, else we'll be in trouble.
Hurry up or else you'll be late.
They can't be coming or else they'd have called.

meanings.def: used to introduce the second of two possibilities
examples: He either forgot or else decided not to come.

meanings.def: used to threaten or warn somebody

examples: Hurry up or else you'll be late.
They can't be coming or else they'd have called.
He either forgot or else decided not to come.

related: I, etc. would sooner do something (than something else)
there is/was nothing (else) for it (but to do something)
